alert.note: Alert for Sabine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 1:44PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN NATCHITOCHES...SABINE PARISHES IN NORTHWESTERN LOUISIANA AND NORTHEASTERN SABINE COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM CST... At 143 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Many, or 24 miles northwest of Anacoco, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Natchitoches, Milam, Many, Zwolle, Campti, Allen, Florien, Provencal, Natchez, Noble, Fisher, Robeline, Powhatan, Melrose, Belmont, Bellwood, Marthaville, Grand Ecore, Mount Carmel, and Negreet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for north central and northwestern Louisiana...and eastern Texas.
